original_table_html:
Fixed costs $300,000 (regardless of sales volume)
Variable costs Added to fixed costs to form total costs, which rise with volume
Total revenue curve Starts at zero and rises with each unit sold. The slope reflects the price of $20 per unit.
summary_markdown: This data illustrates a cost-volume-profit analysis framework, presenting a comparative structure of financial elements. It begins with **Fixed costs**, established at $300,000 and independent of sales volume. These are then combined with **Variable costs**, which are directly proportional to sales volume, to determine **Total costs**. The analysis also includes a **Total revenue curve**, which originates at zero and increases with each unit sold, with its slope dictated by a price of $20 per unit. The core relationship depicted is how these cost and revenue components interact to influence profitability based on sales volume.
